text: "Parisian Thoroughfare," also known as "Parisienne Thorofare," is a jazz standard composed by pianist Bud Powell. It was first recorded by Powell in February of 1951 for Clef Records. ==Notable recordings== *On the 1954 album Clifford Brown & Max Roach which was inducted into the Grammy Hall of Fame in 1999 *Jacky Terrasson and Tom Harrell included the song in their 1991 album Moon and Sand. *Terrason also covered the song in 2002 album Smile. ==References== Category:1950s jazz standards
title: Parisian Thoroughfare
